page.title: 18St. Martin's Church 2.
page.content: The walls began to bulge so were supported by huge granite buttresses, and more were added in l745. These are of blue granite (diorite). In the l9th century a new pulpit was given, also more stained glass windows. A clock was placed in the tower to commemorate Edward VII's coronation. The west window in the south aisle was donated and a lovely brass lectern. The walls were white washed and electric lights were added in l939. The church has a beautiful statue of St. Martin sharing his cloak.
